question: A wooden block of mass M lies on a rough floor. Another wooden block of the same mass is hanging from the point O through strings as shown in the figure. To achieve equilibrium, the co-efficient of static friction between the block on the floor with the floor itself is
images/a1b2c3d4-e5f6-4a7b-8c9d-0e1f2a3b4c5d.png
explanation: Vertical forces on hanging block: $T \sin \theta = Mg$ (i)
Horizontal forces on floor block: $T \cos \theta = f_s = \mu N = \mu Mg$ (ii)
